# ggplot2 practice
Here, we will explore different ways to make graphs in R using ggplot. 

# Task 1: Do your data viz worst
Use the "space_launches.csv" to make the worst graph ever using these: 

- fonts
- background images
- coord_*
- panel / plot / geom / text colors
- point / line patterns and shapes
- gridline updates
- tickmark frequency
- angles
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
# install.packages("ggpubr")
#install.packages("jpeg")
library(ggpubr)
library(jpeg)

img <- readJPEG(here::here("figs", "orca.jpeg"))
space <- read_csv(here::here("data", "space_launches.csv"))

str(space)                  
space <- space %>% select(type, launch_year, mission)  

space %>% group_by(type, launch_year) %>% mutate(num_rockets_type = n()) %>%  ggplot(aes(x = launch_year, y = num_rockets_type, label = rownames(space))) + background_image(img) + geom_boxplot(size = 10, fill = "black", col = "white") + geom_point(aes(col = factor(type)),size = 5, shape = "triangle") +  
   guides(col = "none") + theme_minimal()  + geom_text(family = "Times New Roman", size = 1.5, color = "black") 

#??GeomText
                  
```
